org.smartfrog.services.www
Interface ApplicationServerContext

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Subinterfaces:
JavaEnterpriseApplication, JavaWebApplication, ServletContextComponentDelegate, ServletContextIntf
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractDbcDelegate, ApplicationServerContextImpl, DbcEarDelegate, DbcWarDelegate, EarApplicationImpl, ServletContextImpl, WebApplicationImpl
public interface ApplicationServerContext
extends java.rmi.Remote

An application server context is anything that can be deployed inside an app server. There is a 1:1 mapping of the methods here and those of the normal smartfrog lifecycle, because the relevant delegate operations get called at the appropriate points.

Why the different name? Just so that they can live side-by-side in the same classes.
